sen.j: 環濠集落（かんごうしゅうらく）とは、周囲に堀をめぐらせた集落（ムラ）のこと。
sen.e: A moat settlement is a village surrounded by a moat.
A moat settlement is a village surrounded by a moat.
A moat settlement is a village surrounded by a moat.

sen.j: 水稲農耕とともに大陸からもたらされた新しい集落の境界施設と考えられている。
sen.e: The use of moat is thought to have introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, forming a new style of village boundary.
The use of moat is thought to have been introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, forming a new style of village boundary.
The use of moat is thought to have been introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, forming a new style of village boundary.

sen.j: 堀をめぐらせた場合に環濠と書き、堀をめぐらせた場合に環壕と書いて区別することがある。
sen.e: The word for moat settlement in Japanese may be written in different ways to indicate whether it is a moat filled with water (環濠) or it is a dry moat (環壕).
sen.cmt: Wikipedia の 2010年7月14日 (水) 12:44 現在の版より原文を「水堀をめぐらせた場合に環濠と書き、空堀をめぐらせた場合に環壕と書いて区別することがある。」であるものとして訳出しました。漢字の違いについての説明ですので原文に漢字を残しました。
sen.e: The word for moat settlement in Japanese may be written in different ways to indicate whether it is a moat filled with water (環濠) or it is a dry moat (環壕).
The word for moat settlement in Japanese may be written in different ways to indicate whether it is a moat filled with water (環濠) or it is a dry moat (環壕).

sen.j: 「環濠」と「環壕」のルーツはそれぞれ、長江中流域と内蒙古（興隆窪文化）であると考えられており、日本列島では、弥生時代と中世にかけて各地で作られた。
sen.e: Water moat and dry moat are respectively thought to have its origin in the midstream of the Yangtze River and in Inner Mongolia (where the Xinglongwa Culture flourished), and were built in various places on the Japanese archipelago since the Yayoi period until the medieval period.

Water moat and dry moat are respectively thought to have its origin in the midstream of the Yangtze River and in Inner Mongolia (where the Xinglongwa Culture flourished), and were built in various places on the Japanese archipelago since the Yayoi period until the medieval period.

Water moat and dry moat are respectively thought to have its origin in the midstream of the Yangtze River and in Inner Mongolia (where the Xinglongwa Culture flourished), and were built in various places on the Japanese archipelago since the Yayoi period until the medieval period.

sen.j: 長江中流域では、今から約8000年前の環濠集落が、湖南省のリーヤン平原にある彭頭山遺跡で発見されている。
sen.e: In the midstream of the Yangtze River, remains of an 8,000 years old moat settlement were discovered at the Pengtoushan site, located on the Li Yang flatlands in Hunan Province.
In the midstream of the Yangtze River, remains of an 8,000 years old moat settlement were discovered at the Pengtoushan site, located on the Li Yang flatlands in Hunan Province.
In the midstream of the Yangtze River, remains of an 8,000 years old moat settlement were discovered at the Pengtoushan site, located on the Li Yang flatlands in Hunan Province.

sen.j: この環濠集落の直径が約200メートルで、西側が自然河川に繋がっており、北側と東側、南側には、幅約20メートルの濠が巡っているらしい。
sen.e: The moat settlement spanned approximately 200 m across, and while the village was directly facing the natural river on the west side, it was apparently surrounded by a moat of about 20 m wide on the north, east and south sides.

The moat settlement spanned approximately 200 m across, and while the village was directly facing the natural river on the west side, it was apparently surrounded by a moat of about 20 m wide on the north, east and south sides.

The moat settlement spanned approximately 200 m across, and while the village was directly facing the natural river on the west side, it was apparently surrounded by a moat of about 20 m wide on the north, east and south sides.

sen.j: 充分な発掘調査はまだであるが、水田稲作農耕の遺跡である。
sen.e: These remains of wet-rice farming await further excavation for details to be known.
These remains of wet-rice farming await further excavation for details to be known.
These remains of wet-rice farming await further excavation for details to be known.

sen.j: 内蒙古自治区赤峰市にある興隆窪遺跡から、約8200～7400年前の環濠集落が見つかっている。
sen.e: At the Xinglongwa site located in Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia, remains of an approximately 7,400 to 8,200 years old moat settlement were discovered.
At the Xinglongwa site located in Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia, remains of an approximately 7,400 to 8,200 years old moat settlement were discovered.
At the Xinglongwa site located in Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia, remains of an approximately 7,400 to 8,200 years old moat settlement were discovered.

sen.j: この集落は、長軸183メートル、短軸166メートルの平面形が楕円形に巡る溝によって囲まれている。
sen.e: Here a village occupying a rectangular ground area of 183 m (long-side) by 166 m (short-side) was surrounded by an oval moat.
sen.cmt: 「長軸」「短軸」はカッコ内に示しました。原文は「軸」となっていますが、「平面形」（矩形)にかかっているので「辺」を意味するものとして "side" としました。
sen.e: Here a village occupying a rectangular ground area of 183 m (long-side) by 166 m (short-side) was surrounded by an oval moat.
Here a village occupying a rectangular ground area of 183 m (long-side) by 166 m (short-side) was surrounded by an oval moat.

sen.j: 溝の幅は約1.5～2メートルあり、深さは約1メートルほどである。
sen.e: The moat measured about 1.5 to 2 m wide and 1 m deep.
The moat measured about 1.5 to 2 m wide and 1 m deep.
The moat measured about 1.5 to 2 m wide and 1 m deep.

sen.j: 環濠の内側から約100棟の竪穴式住居が発見されている。
sen.e: About 100 pit dwellings were found inside the moat surrounded area.
About 100 pit dwellings were found inside the moat surrounded area.
About 100 pit dwellings were found inside the moat surrounded area.

sen.j: この集落の生業はアワなどを栽培する畑作農業である。
sen.e: The inhabitants were living on cultivating crops such as millet.
The inhabitants lived on cultivating crops such as millet.
The inhabitants lived on cultivating crops such as millet.

sen.j: 中国で誕生した環濠集落は、農耕文化の重要な要素の一つとして、朝鮮半島を経由して日本列島に伝来した。
sen.e: Originating in China, moat settlement was transmitted to Japan through the Korean Peninsula as one of the important elements of agricultural culture.
Originating in China, moat settlement was transmitted to Japan through the Korean Peninsula as one of the important elements of agricultural culture.
Originating in China, moat settlement was transmitted to Japan through the Korean Peninsula as one of the important elements of agricultural culture.

tit.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。

sen.j: 環濠集落には、防御と拠点という特色がみられる。
sen.e: The characteristics of moat settlement was twofold: it was a defensive fort and a foothold.
The characteristics of moat settlement was twofold: it was a defensive fort and a foothold.
The characteristics of moat settlement was twofold: it was a defensive fort and a foothold.

sen.j: 断面が深くV字形に掘削された環濠やその周辺に逆茂木（さかもぎ）と称されるような先を尖らせた杭を埋め込んでいる様子から集落の防御的性格があったことが窺える。
sen.e: The defensive aspect can be seen by the way moats were dug down, steeply to a point at the bottom making it shaped like a "V," being accompanied with abates, which are kind of stakes with sharpened tops directed outwards, along its sidelines.

The defensive aspect can be seen by the way moats were dug down, steeply to a point at the bottom making it shaped like a "V," being accompanied with abatis called Sakamogi, which are kind of stakes with sharpened tops directed outwards, along its sidelines.
sen.cmt: abates → abatis called Sakamogi に修正しました。
sen.e: The defensive aspect can be seen by the way moats were dug down, steeply to a point at the bottom making it shaped like a "V," being accompanied with abatis called Sakamogi, which are kind of stakes with sharpened tops directed outwards, along its sidelines.

sen.j: また、大規模な集落については、長期間継続し、人口も集住し、周辺に小集落が存在し、首長の居宅や祭祀用の大型掘っ立て柱建物があり、金属器生産が行われ、遠隔地との交流物品が出土する。
sen.e: Larger settlements were surrounded by neighboring smaller settlements, were used over a longer time with a larger number of population, contained the chief's residence and a large pit facility where rituals were held, produced metal ware in the village, and various materials received from remote regions in trade are excavated from remaining sites.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 （後半を分割しました。）
sen.e: Larger settlements were surrounded by neighboring smaller settlements, were used over a longer time with a larger number of population, contained the chief's residence and a large pit facility where rituals were held, produced metal ware in the village, and various materials received from remote regions in trade are excavated from remaining sites.

Larger settlements were surrounded by neighboring smaller settlements, were used over a longer time with a larger number of population, contained the chief's residence and a large pit facility where rituals were held, produced metal ware in the village, and various materials received from remote regions in trade are excavated from remaining sites.

sen.j: これらから、政治的・経済的集落であり、拠点的集落という性格を有すると考えられる。
sen.e: These findings show that larger moat settlements functioned as a central foothold of politics and economy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: These findings show that larger moat settlements functioned as a central foothold of politics and economy.
These findings show that larger moat settlements functioned as a central foothold of politics and economy.

sen.j: 倭国における王権形成期とされる弥生時代中期には防御的性格を強め、高地性集落とともに、王権形成過程の軍事的動向を反映していると考えられている。
sen.e: As Wakoku was strengthening its position as a kingdom during the mid-Yayoi period, the defensive aspect of moat settlements as well as upland settlements became more evident to reflect the kingdom's military trend.

As Wakoku was strengthening its position as a kingdom during the mid-Yayoi period, the defensive aspect of moat settlements as well as upland settlements became more evident to reflect the kingdom's military trend.

As Wakoku was strengthening its position as a kingdom during the mid-Yayoi period, the defensive aspect of moat settlements as well as upland settlements became more evident to reflect the kingdom's military trend.

sen.j: 王権形成が進み古墳時代に入ると、首長層は共同体の外部に居館を置くようになり、環濠集落は次第に解体される。
sen.e: Once Wakoku had advanced its sovereignty by early Kofun (tumulus) period, chiefs began placing their residences outside the village, and moat settlements were gradually dismantled.
Once Wakoku had advanced its sovereignty by early Kofun (tumulus) period, chiefs began placing their residences outside the village, and moat settlements were gradually dismantled.
Once Wakoku had advanced its sovereignty by early Kofun (tumulus) period, chiefs began placing their residences outside the village, and moat settlements were gradually dismantled.

sen.j: 環濠集落は朝鮮半島南部でも見られ、北九州では縄文時代晩期（前4世紀）の環濠集落がある。
sen.e: Moat settlements of this time can be found in the southern area of Korean Peninsula, as well as in northern Kyushu, which dates to late Jomon period (the fourth century B.C.)
Moat settlements of this time can be found in the southern area of Korean Peninsula, as well as in northern Kyushu, which dates to late Jomon period (the fourth century B.C.)
Moat settlements of this time can be found in the southern area of Korean Peninsula, as well as in northern Kyushu, which dates to late Jomon period (the fourth century B.C.)

sen.j: 縄文人のムラは環濠を形成しない傾向にある。
sen.e: Jomon man village tended not to have any moat.
Jomon man village tended not to have any moat.
Jomon man village tended not to have any moat.

sen.j: しかし、今から約4000年前、北海道苫小牧市にある静川（しずかわ）16遺跡から幅1~2メートル、深さが2メートルほどあり、断面形がV字状になった溝が、長軸約56メートル、短軸約40メートルの不正楕円形にめぐる環濠集落が発見されている。
sen.e: Ruins of a moat settlement, estimated to be 4,000 years old, was found in Shizukawa 16, Tomakomai City, Hokkaido, whose surrounding oval ditch measured about 56 m (major axis) by 40 m (minor axis) large, 2 m deep with a "V" shaped cross section and 1 to 2 m wide.
sen.cmt: 原文を次のとおりの意味と解釈し、訳出しました（4000年前に発見されたのではなく、4000年前の遺跡が発見された）「しかし、北海道苫小牧市にある静川（しずかわ）16遺跡からは、幅1~2メートル、深さが2メートルほどあり、断面形がV字状になった溝が、長軸約56メートル、短軸約40メートルの不正楕円形にめぐる、約4000年前のものと思われる環濠集落が発見されている。」なお、「静川16」は地名をとった名前ですので通常の住所表示であれば "16 Shizukawa" とすることも可能ですが、それではわかりにくいので"Shizukawa 16" としました。http://www.city.tomakomai.hokkaido.jp/shogaigakushu/bunkazai/sizukawa/sizukawa.htm
sen.e: Ruins of a moat settlement, estimated to be 4,000 years old, was found in Shizukawa 16, Tomakomai City, Hokkaido, whose surrounding oval ditch measured about 56 m (major axis) by 40 m (minor axis) large, 2 m deep with a "V" shaped cross section and 1 to 2 m wide.

Ruins of a moat settlement, estimated to be 4,000 years old, was found in Shizukawa 16, Tomakomai City, Hokkaido, whose surrounding oval ditch measured about 56 m (major axis) by 40 m (minor axis) large, 2 m deep with a "V" shaped cross section and 1 to 2 m wide.

sen.j: 環濠の内側から2棟、外側からは15棟の円形竪穴住居が見いだされている。
sen.e: Two round shaped pit dwelling houses were discovered inside the moat surrounded area, while 15 were discovered outside.
sen.cmt: 上記の溝に関する記述も含め、遺構の数や大きさがネット上で閲覧できる資料と異なりますが、原文どおりに訳出しました。
sen.e: Two round shaped pit dwelling houses were discovered inside the moat surrounded area, while 15 were discovered outside.
Two round shaped pit dwelling houses were discovered inside the moat surrounded area, while 15 were discovered outside.

sen.j: それは、弥生の環濠集落とは性格を異にするものであろう。
sen.e: This moat settlement is thought to have had different functions than that of Yayoi period.
This moat settlement is thought to have had different functions than that of Yayoi period.
This moat settlement is thought to have had different functions than that of Yayoi period.

sen.j: 例えば、縄文人の祭祀の空間だったのかも知れない。
sen.e: For example, it may have been a place where Jomon man held religious services.
For example, it may have been a place where Jomon man held religious services.
For example, it may have been a place where Jomon man held religious services.

sen.j: 縄文時代の環濠集落は、現在のところこの遺跡のみである。
sen.e: This is the only moat settlement site of the Jomon period discovered to date.
This is the only moat settlement site of the Jomon period discovered to date.
This is the only moat settlement site of the Jomon period discovered to date.

sen.j: 環濠集落は稲作文化と同時に大陸から伝来し、列島東部へ波及したと考えられている。
sen.e: The moat settlement is thought to have introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, spreading eastward on the archipelago.
The moat settlement is thought to have introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, spreading eastward on the archipelago.
The moat settlement is thought to have introduced to Japan from the Chinese continent along with wet-rice cultivation, spreading eastward on the archipelago.

sen.j: しかし、2世紀後半から3世紀初頭には、弥生時代の集落を特徴付ける環濠が各地で消滅していく。
sen.e: Between the end of the second century and the beginning of the third century, however, this distinctive Yayoi period style of moat settlement started to disappear from many regions.
Between the end of the second century and the beginning of the third century, however, this distinctive Yayoi period style of moat settlement started to disappear from many regions.
Between the end of the second century and the beginning of the third century, however, this distinctive Yayoi period style of moat settlement started to disappear from many regions.

sen.j: この時期に、西日本から東海、関東にかけて政治的状況が大きく変わったことを示すものとして考えられている。
sen.e: This is believed to be some sign signifying a radical change in the political situation that was happening around this time, not only in western Japan but also in Tokai and Kanto regions.
This is believed to be some sign signifying a radical change in the political situation that was happening around this time, not only in western Japan but also in Tokai and Kanto regions.
This is believed to be some sign signifying a radical change in the political situation that was happening around this time, not only in western Japan but also in Tokai and Kanto regions.

sen.j: 今のところ、弥生時代でもっとも古い環濠集落は、北部九州の玄界灘沿岸部に位置する福岡県粕屋町の江辻遺跡で弥生時代早期のものが見つかっている。
sen.e: The oldest moat settlement from the Yayoi period known until now is the one from Initial Yayoi period discovered at Etsuji site of Kasuya-machi, Fukuoka Prefecture, located nearby the coast of Genkainada in northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 前後の文脈から、これ以降に出現するの「早期」「前期」「中期以降」などは弥生時代の区分を指すものと推測されます。訳語については以下の書籍を参考にしました。"Initial Yayoi period"で特定の期間を指すことをわかりやすくするために区分名を大文字表記としました: http://books.google.co.jp/books?hl=ja&lr=&id=zkteuesBwpQC&oi=fnd&pg=PA442&dq=yayoi+period+initial+early+middle+late&ots=-5hAk-tB68&sig=736Zq-8SL2tdkIE5uMOL8ExL2z0#v=onepage&q=yayoi%20period%20initial%20early%20middle%20late&f=false
sen.e: The oldest moat settlement from the Yayoi period known until now is the one from Initial Yayoi period discovered at Etsuji site of Kasuya-machi, Fukuoka Prefecture, located nearby the coast of Genkainada in northern Kyushu.

The oldest moat settlement from the Yayoi period known until now is the one from Initial Yayoi period discovered at Etsuji site of Kasuya-machi, Fukuoka Prefecture, located nearby the coast of Genkainada in northern Kyushu.

sen.j: 近畿では早期の環濠集落はないが、前期前半では神戸市大開遺跡がある。
sen.e: In Kinki region, there is a moat settlement from the first half of the Early Yayoi period found at Daikai site in Kobe city, while none is known from the Initial Yayoi period.
In Kinki region, there is a moat settlement from the first half of the Early Yayoi period found at Daikai site in Kobe city, while none is known from the Initial Yayoi period.
In Kinki region, there is a moat settlement from the first half of the Early Yayoi period found at Daikai site in Kobe city, while none is known from the Initial Yayoi period.

sen.j: 長径70メートル、短径40メートルで、環濠内からは竪穴住居と貯蔵穴が検出されている。
sen.e: Surrounded by a moat measuring 70 m (long-side) by 40 m (short-side), several pit dwelling houses and storages were found.
Surrounded by a moat measuring 70 m (long-side) by 40 m (short-side), several pit dwelling houses and storages were found.
Surrounded by a moat measuring 70 m (long-side) by 40 m (short-side), several pit dwelling houses and storages were found.

sen.j: 環濠の断面はV字形と逆台形で、溝の幅2メートル、深さ1.5メートルあったと推定されている。
sen.e: The moat had "V" and "U" shaped sections, and is believed to have been 2 m wide and 1.5 m deep.
The moat had "V" and "U" shaped sections, and is believed to have been 2 m wide and 1.5 m deep.
The moat had "V" and "U" shaped sections, and is believed to have been 2 m wide and 1.5 m deep.

sen.j: 出土した石器のうち打製石器が大きな割合を占めている。
sen.e: Most stone tools excavated from the site were simpler ones shaped by chipping or flaking.
sen.cmt: Web上のWikipediaより(2つ目の)「石器」を「打製石器」と変更しました。「打製石器」に近い用語として"Oldowan" や "Mode 1"などの専門用語があるようですが、いずれも説明なしには理解しがたいと思われますので、説明的な訳としました。
sen.e: Most stone tools excavated from the site were simpler ones shaped by chipping or flaking.
Most stone tools excavated from the site were simpler ones shaped by chipping or flaking.

sen.j: 愛知県の朝日遺跡は、弥生時代中期の集落であり、環濠集落のなかでも最も防御施設の発達した集落として知られている。
sen.e: The moat settlement discovered at Asahi site in Aichi Prefecture is an example from the Middle Yayoi period, and is known for having consisted of some of the most advanced defensive facilities.
The moat settlement discovered at Asahi site in Aichi Prefecture is an example from the Middle Yayoi period, and is known for having consisted of some of the most advanced defensive facilities.
The moat settlement discovered at Asahi site in Aichi Prefecture is an example from the Middle Yayoi period, and is known for having consisted of some of the most advanced defensive facilities.

sen.j: 集落の外側に大濠をめぐらせて、その土で土塁を築き、その上に柵をめぐらし、その外側に三重の柵をめぐらし、この三重の柵に逆茂木を外側に向けて打ち込んでいる。
sen.e: Here the village was encircled by a large moat fortified with an earthen wall equipped with a fence on top, further surrounded by three external bands of fences with abates directed outwards.
sen.cmt: 次の図を参考に訳出しました。http://www.pref.aichi.jp/kyoiku/bunka/asahi/net3-1/index.html
sen.e: Here the village was encircled by a large moat fortified with an earthen wall equipped with a fence on top, further surrounded by three external bands of fences with abatis directed outwards.
Here the village was encircled by a large moat fortified with an earthen wall equipped with a fence on top, further surrounded by three external bands of fences with abatis directed outwards.

sen.j: 発掘調査によって、土塁の上にはピット (考古学)（柱穴）が検出されることがあり、柵列があったと思われる。
sen.e: Pits were excavated on top of the earthen wall which suggests the existence of a fence above the wall.
Pits were excavated on top of the earthen wall which suggests the existence of a fence above the wall.
Pits were excavated on top of the earthen wall which suggests the existence of a fence above the wall.

sen.j: 弥生時代前期末以降に発達する環濠集落は、濃尾平野以西の各地域に水稲農耕が定着した段階であり、その定着によって引き起こされた土地や水争いなどの村落間の戦いに備えて独自に成立したと見られる。
sen.e: Individual moat settlements were developed beyond the end of Early Yayoi period in preparation for conflicts between villages over the control of land and water, as wet-rice cultivation became established in various districts on the west side of the Nobi Plain.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味を「弥生時代前期末以降に発達した環濠集落は、濃尾平野以西の各地域に水稲農耕が定着し、それによって引き起こされた土地や水争いなどの村落間の戦いに備えて独自に成立した集落であると見られる。」と解釈し、訳出しました。ここでの「独自に」は「個別に」の意であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: Individual moat settlements were developed beyond the end of Early Yayoi period in preparation for conflicts between villages over the control of land and water, as wet-rice cultivation became established in various districts on the west side of the Nobi Plain.

Individual moat settlements were developed beyond the end of Early Yayoi period in preparation for conflicts between villages over the control of land and water, as wet-rice cultivation became established in various districts on the west side of the Nobi Plain.

sen.j: そのころ、福岡市の板付遺跡と大阪府高槻市の安満遺跡、京都府中郡峰山町扇谷遺跡などに環濠集落が現れる。
sen.e: About the same time, moat settlements appeared in such places as present-day Itatsuki of Fukuoka City, Ama of Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture, and Ogidani of Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 弥生時代当時はまだ「遺跡」ではないはずですので、原文を「そのころ、現在の福岡市の板付、大阪府高槻市の安満、京都府京丹後市扇谷などに環濠集落が現れた。」の意であるものとして訳出しました。峰山町は現在京丹後市となっています。
sen.e: About the same time, moat settlements appeared in such places as Itatsuki site in Fukuoka City, Ama site in Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture, and Ogidani site in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 弥生時代でも遺跡はありようですので、site を挿入しました。
sen.e: About the same time, moat settlements appeared in such places as Itatsuki site in Fukuoka City, Ama site in Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture, and Ogidani site in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 板付では復元幅2メートル以上、深さ1メール以上の断面V字形の溝を、長径120メートル、短径100メートルの長円形に堀めぐらしている。
sen.e: The settlement at Itatsuki had a surrounding "V" shaped moat of at least 2 m wide and deeper than 1 m, forming an oval measuring 120 m (major axis) by 100 m (minor axis).
sen.cmt: 原文の意図は元の様子を説明するものとして「復元」は無視して訳出しました。 "an oval measuring XXX m by YYY m" だけで原文の「長径」「短径」は不要と思われますが、念のためカッコ内に残してあります。
sen.e: The settlement at Itatsuki site had a surrounding "V" shaped moat of at least 2 m wide and deeper than 1 m, forming an oval measuring 120 m (major axis) by 100 m (minor axis).
The settlement at Itatsuki site had a surrounding "V" shaped moat of at least 2 m wide and deeper than 1 m, forming an oval measuring 120 m (major axis) by 100 m (minor axis).

sen.j: 濠外にも住居や穴倉がある。
sen.e: Dwellings and pits were also discovered outside the moat encircled area.
Dwellings and pits were also discovered outside the moat.
Dwellings and pits were also discovered outside the moat.

sen.j: 扇谷遺跡では、最大幅6メートル、深さ4メートルの環濠か、長径270メートル、短径250メートルでムラを囲っている。
sen.e: At Ogidani site, the village was surrounded by a moat measuring 270 m (major axis) by 250 m (minor axis), 6 m wide in its widest section and 4 m deep.
sen.cmt: 「環濠か」は「環濠が」であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: At Ogidani site, the village was surrounded by a moat measuring 270 m (major axis) by 250 m (minor axis), 6 m wide in its widest section and 4 m deep.
At Ogidani site, the village was surrounded by a moat measuring 270 m (major axis) by 250 m (minor axis), 6 m wide in its widest section and 4 m deep.

sen.j: これらの遺跡からムラを防御していることが考えられる。
sen.e: The layout discovered at these sites suggests that the moat was for defending the village.
sen.cmt: 原文意図を「これらの遺跡で発見された配置から、環濠はムラを防御していたものと考えられる。」であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: The layout discovered at these sites suggests that the moat was for defending the village.
The layout discovered at these sites suggests that the moat was for defending the village.

sen.j: また、北部九州や近畿地方などの西日本では、水稲農耕の定着した時期の弥生時代前期末段階で、ムラづくりが共通していたとも考えられる。
sen.e: Village constructions were probably common by the end of Early Yayoi period in regions such as northern Kyushu and Kinki, where wet-rice cultivation had been established by that time.
Village constructions were probably common by the end of Early Yayoi period in regions such as northern Kyushu and Kinki, where wet-rice cultivation had been established by that time.
Village constructions were probably common by the end of Early Yayoi period in regions such as northern Kyushu and Kinki, where wet-rice cultivation had been established by that time.

sen.j: 次の弥生中期以降、近畿では環濠集落が普及し、径300から400メートルに及ぶ大規模な環濠を持ち、人々は濠内に集住したらしい。
sen.e: After Middle Yayoi period and onwards, moat settlements were spread all over Kinki region, and people lived in large villages that had a surrounding moat of 300 m to 400 m in diameter.
After Middle Yayoi period and onwards, moat settlements were spread all over Kinki region, and people lived in large villages that had a surrounding moat of 300 m to 400 m in diameter.
After Middle Yayoi period and onwards, moat settlements were spread all over Kinki region, and people lived in large villages that had a surrounding moat of 300 m to 400 m in diameter.

sen.j: 後期では北部北九州では佐賀県吉野ヶ里遺跡や大阪府の安満遺跡や池上・曽根遺跡、奈良県の唐古・鍵遺跡などの大規模環濠集落が上げられる。
sen.e: Yoshinogari site in Saga Prefecture, Ama and Ikegami-Sone sites in Osaka Prefecture, and Karako-Kagi site in Nara Prefecture are examples of places where large scale moat settlements from Late Yayoi period existed.

Yoshinogari site in Saga Prefecture, Ama and Ikegami-Sone sites in Osaka Prefecture, and Karako-Kagi site in Nara Prefecture are examples of places where large scale moat settlements from Late Yayoi period existed.

Yoshinogari site in Saga Prefecture, Ama and Ikegami-Sone sites in Osaka Prefecture, and Karako-Kagi site in Nara Prefecture are examples of places where large scale moat settlements from Late Yayoi period existed.

sen.j: 低地に作られ、通常は堀の外側に掘った土を盛った土塁がある（対照的に、中世の土塁は堀の内側にある）。
sen.e: Moat settlements of this period were built in lowlands, and usually had an earthen wall on the outer side of the moat (whereas in the Medieval period earthen walls were built on the inner side).
Moat settlements of this period were built in lowlands, and usually had an earthen wall on the outer side of the moat (whereas in the Medieval period earthen walls were built on the inner side).
Moat settlements of this period were built in lowlands, and usually had an earthen wall on the outer side of the moat (whereas in the Medieval period earthen walls were built on the inner side).

sen.j: ムラの内部と外部を区別する環濠を形成する目的として、外敵や獣などから集落を守る防御機能を備えることが考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that the purpose of creating a moat to divide the inner and outer space of a village was to protect itself from being attacked by any external enemy or wild life.
It is believed that the purpose of creating a moat to divide the inner and outer space of a village was to protect itself from being attacked by any external enemy or wild life.
It is believed that the purpose of creating a moat to divide the inner and outer space of a village was to protect itself from being attacked by any external enemy or wild life.

sen.j: 堀は二重・三重の多重環濠となることもあり、長大な環濠帯を形成しているものもある。
sen.e: In some cases there were two or three moats built, forming together a huge moat band zone.
In some cases there were two or three moats built, forming together a huge moat band zone.
In some cases there were two or three moats built, forming together a huge moat band zone.

sen.j: 水稲農耕に必要な首長権力や、共同体の結束強化、内部と外部での階級差を反映しているとも考えられている。
sen.e: The different size of moats were probably representing how strong a chieftaincy's controlling power was over wet-rice cultivation in the area, how tight the community was united, or the difference in villager classes who lived inside and outside the moat.

The different size of moats were probably representing how strong a chieftaincy's controlling power was over wet-rice cultivation in the area, how tight the community was united, or the difference in villager classes who lived inside and outside the moat.

The different size of moats were probably representing how strong a chieftaincy's controlling power was over wet-rice cultivation in the area, how tight the community was united, or the difference in villager classes who lived inside and outside the moat.

sen.j: また、水堀の場合には治水の機能をもたせることができる。
sen.e: Water moats also functioned as flood control.
Water moats also functioned as flood control.
Water moats also functioned as flood control.

sen.j: 室町時代の後半の戦国時代 (日本)では戦乱が多発し、農村では集落を守るために周囲に堀（環濠）を巡らして襲撃に備えるところが現れた。
sen.e: The latter half of the Muromachi period was the Sengoku period when warfare broke out all over Japan, making some villagers decide to build moats around their settlements in order to protect themselves from assaults.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 （後半を分割しました。）
sen.e: The latter half of the Muromachi period was the Sengoku period (period of warring states) when warfare broke out all over Japan, making some villagers decide to build moats around their settlements in order to protect themselves from assaults.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処OK 用語共有に沿って説明を追加しました。
sen.e: The latter half of the Muromachi period was the Sengoku period (period of warring states) when warfare broke out all over Japan, making some villagers decide to build moats around their settlements in order to protect themselves from assaults.

sen.j: これらは中世の環濠集落として現在も各地に点在している。
sen.e: Remainders of these medieval moat settlements can still be seen in various places of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Remainders of these medieval moat settlements can still be seen in various places of Japan.
Remainders of these medieval moat settlements can still be seen in various places of Japan.

sen.j: 有力な仏教寺院が中心に存在し、規模が大きくなる場合は「寺内町」となる。
sen.e: Moat settlements which grew in scale with an influential Buddhist temple at its center came to be known as Jinai-cho (literally a town with a temple inside).
Moat settlements which grew in scale with an influential Buddhist temple at its center came to be known as Jinai-cho (literally a town with a temple inside).
Moat settlements which grew in scale with an influential Buddhist temple at its center came to be known as Jinai-cho (literally a town with a temple inside).

sen.j: 現在でも当時以来の姿を残した環濠集落が、わずかながら存在する。
sen.e: There are a limited number of moat settlements which still retains the original features.
There are a limited number of moat settlements which still retain the original features.
There are a limited number of moat settlements which still retain the original features.

sen.j: 吉野ヶ里遺跡の遺構からは、大規模な環濠集落の全貌が明らかにされた。
sen.e: The full picture of a large scale moat settlement was revealed from the remains at the Yoshinogari site.
The full picture of a large scale moat settlement was revealed from the remains at the Yoshinogari site.
The full picture of a large scale moat settlement was revealed from the remains at the Yoshinogari site.

sen.j: また、最近では伊邪那美神陵伝説地の一つである安来市伯太町からも経塚鼻遺跡が発掘され話題を呼んでいる。
sen.e: The recent discovery of Kyozukabana remains in Hakuta-cho, Yasugi City, a land where legend holds that Izanami no kami was buried, was an event which drew wide public attention.
The recent discovery of Kyozukabana remains in Hakuta-cho, Yasugi City, a land where legend holds that Izanami no kami was buried, was an event which drew wide public attention.
The recent discovery of Kyozukabana remains in Hakuta-cho, Yasugi City, a land where legend holds that Izanami no kami was buried, was an event which drew wide public attention.

sen.j: 早期
sen.e: Initial Yayoi period
sen.cmt: 前出同様、「早期」「前期」「中期以降」は弥生時代の区分を指すものと推測されます。より明瞭な項目名にするためそれぞれを「弥生時代早期」「～後期」であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: Initial Yayoi period
Initial Yayoi period

sen.j: 江辻遺跡（福岡県粕屋町）弥生時代早期後半、幅約1メートルほどの浅い溝が周囲を二重に巡っている。
sen.e: The moat settlement at Etsuji site (Kasuya-cho, Fukuoka Prefecture) is an example of latter half of Initial Yayoi period, surrounded by two shallow ditches of about one meter wide.
The moat settlement at Etsuji site (Kasuya-cho, Fukuoka Prefecture) is an example of latter half of Initial Yayoi period, surrounded by two shallow ditches of about one meter wide.
The moat settlement at Etsuji site (Kasuya-cho, Fukuoka Prefecture) is an example of latter half of Initial Yayoi period, surrounded by two shallow ditches of about one meter wide.

sen.j: この集落は、朝鮮半島南部の影響を強く受けて、成立したものか。
sen.e: This settlement's style was probably made with the strong influence from that in the southern area of Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 「影響を受けた」のは集落の形態であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: This settlement's style was probably made with the strong influence from that in the southern area of Korean Peninsula.
This settlement's style was probably made with the strong influence from that in the southern area of Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 那珂遺跡（福岡県）正円に近い二重の環濠、外径150メートル。
sen.e: The double moats found at Naka site (Fukuoka Prefecture) are almost perfect circles with an outside diameter of 150 m.
The double moats found at Naka site (Fukuoka Prefecture) are almost perfect circles with an outside diameter of 150 m.
The double moats found at Naka site (Fukuoka Prefecture) are almost perfect circles with an outside diameter of 150 m.

sen.j: 前期
sen.e: Early Yayoi period
Early Yayoi period
Early Yayoi period

sen.j: 北部九州から瀬戸内海沿岸地域、大阪湾沿岸へと東進波及する。
sen.e: Moat settlements began to spread eastward from northern part of Kyushu along the coast of Seto Inland Sea, and then to Osaka Bay area.
Moat settlements began to spread eastward from northern part of Kyushu along the coast of Seto Inland Sea, and then to Osaka Bay area.
Moat settlements began to spread eastward from northern part of Kyushu along the coast of Seto Inland Sea, and then to Osaka Bay area.

sen.j: 規模は、径70～150メートル、卵形、小規模で大環濠に肥大しない。
sen.e: The size of the moat settlement remained small, 70 m to 150 m in diameter, and did not grow bigger than that.
The size of the moat settlement remained small, 70 m to 150 m in diameter, and did not grow bigger than that.
The size of the moat settlement remained small, 70 m to 150 m in diameter, and did not grow bigger than that.

sen.j: 板付遺跡（福岡市）
sen.e: Itatsuki site (Fukuoka City)
sen.cmt: 「遺跡一覧」の「遺跡」の訳語については "site" に統一しました。公式サイトや用語集で ruins, relics など、別の語を用いている場合がありますが、ばらばらになってしまいますので、リスト内では論文など広く一般的に使われている "site"としました。
sen.e: Itatsuki site (Fukuoka City)
Itatsuki site (Fukuoka City)

sen.j: 百間川沢田遺跡（岡山県）
sen.e: Hyakkengawa-Sawada site (Okayama Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 「百間川」は河川名ですが、河川についての記事ではなく、遺跡名の一部を構成していますのでここでは翻訳指示書のように「～gawa River」とはしませんでした。(単に「Hyakkengawa-Sawada site」とする学術論文があります http://society-for-east-asian-archaeology.org/arc-eaa-13.htm)
sen.e: Hyakkengawa-Sawada site (Okayama Prefecture)
Hyakkengawa-Sawada site (Okayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 中ノ池遺跡（香川県善通寺市）
sen.e: Nakanoike site (Zentsuji City, Kagawa Prefecture)
Nakanoike site (Zentsuji City, Kagawa Prefecture)
Nakanoike site (Zentsuji City, Kagawa Prefecture)

sen.j: 大開遺跡（兵庫県神戸市）
sen.e: Daikai site (Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture)
Daikai site (Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture)
Daikai site (Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 安満遺跡（大阪府高槻市）
sen.e: Ama site (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 高槻市関連サイト（英語）では「ruins」でした。ご参考： http://www.takatsuki-intl-assn.or.jp/english_home.html
sen.e: Ama site (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture)
Ama site (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 扇谷遺跡（京都府京丹後市、旧峰山町、山陰地方）
sen.e: Ogidani site (Kyotango City [previously Mineyama-cho], Kyoto Prefecture, Sanin region)
sen.cmt: 京丹後市公式パンフレットでは「ruins」でした。http://www.city.kyotango.kyoto.jp/shisei/shisei/shiseiyoran/documents/03tokusyu2.pdf なお、この項目だけ「山陰地方」がついていて不自然ですが、原文どおり残しています。
sen.e: Ogidani site (Kyotango City [previously Mineyama-cho], Kyoto Prefecture, Sanin region)
Ogidani site (Kyotango City [previously Mineyama-cho], Kyoto Prefecture, Sanin region)

sen.j: 中期以降
sen.e: Middle Yayoi period and later
Middle Yayoi period and later

sen.j: 原の辻遺跡（長崎県壱岐島南東部）
sen.e: Harunotsuji site (south-east of Iki Island, Nagasaki Prefecture)
Harunotsuji site (south-east of Iki Island, Nagasaki Prefecture)

Kyozukabana site (Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture)

sen.j: 池上・曽根遺跡（大阪府和泉市と泉大津市にまたがる）
sen.e: Ikegami-Sone site (lies across the border of Izumi City and Izumiotsu City, Osaka Prefecture)
Ikegami-Sone site (lies across the border of Izumi City and Izumiotsu City, Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 稗田の環濠集落（奈良県大和郡山市）
sen.e: Hieda moat settlement (Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture)
Hieda moat settlement (Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.e: Karako-Kagi site (Tawaramoto-cho, Nara Prefecture)
Karako-Kagi site (Tawaramoto-cho, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 太田・黒田遺跡（和歌山県和歌山市）
sen.e: Ota-Kuroda site (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture)
Ota-Kuroda site (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture)

sen.j: 朝日遺跡（愛知県清須市、春日町、名古屋市にまたがる）最も防御施設が充実した遺跡
sen.e: Asahi site (lies across the borders of Kiyosu City, Kasuga-cho and Nagoya City, and has one of the most heavily equipped defensive structures)
